New Records: Georgia achieved the biggest upset in European Championship history by defeating Portugal 2-0.
Georges Mikautadze is the only player at Euro 2024 to score three times in the group stage.
Cristiano Ronaldo failed to score a group-stage goal at a major tournament for the first time in his career spanning 11 tournaments.
Georgia had the lowest possession by a winning team at the European Championship on record (since 1980) with just 28% possession.
Key Match Events: Khvicha Kvaratskhelia scored a goal after just 93 seconds.
Georges Mikautadze scored a penalty in the 57th minute.
Mamardashvili made a key save from Semedo in the 90+2 minute.
Jota had a close chance to score in stoppage time but missed.
Post-Match Reflections: Khvicha Kvaratskhelia was awarded UEFA's Player of the Match.
Georgia will face Spain in the last 16.
Portugal will face Slovenia in the last 16.
Georgia's victory was described as richly deserved and a historic moment for the 74th ranked nation in world football.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Georgia's midfield outperformed Portugal's more expensive midfield.
Mamardashvili and the defense were praised for their performance.
Kvaratskhelia's performance was highlighted as a standout in the tournament.
